title: Fraud & Payment Blog | Outseer
original_content: This Outseer blog focuses on the future of fraud prevention, emphasizing the use of behavioral biometrics as a strategic signal for improved fraud detection. It also discusses the importance of a coordinated defense framework for banks and nations to effectively combat scams.

title: Report: Why Collaboration Via 3-D Secure is Key to Beating CNP Fraud | Outseer
original_content: A new study highlights that widespread adoption and collaboration using 3-D Secure (3DS) is key to significantly reducing card-not-present (CNP) fraud, which is projected to cost businesses billions. While 3DS is effective on its own, its benefits are amplified when more merchants, issuers, and networks participate, leading to lower fraud rates and improved checkout experiences. The US lags behind other regions in 3DS adoption, resulting in disproportionately higher CNP fraud losses.
smart_summary: While 3DS is effective on its own, its benefits are amplified when more merchants, issuers, and networks participate, leading to lower fraud rates and improved checkout experiences. A new study highlights that widespread adoption and collaboration using 3-D Secure (3DS) is key to significantly reducing card-not-present (CNP) fraud, which is projected to cost businesses billions.

title: 3-D Secure July Release: Compliance and Security with New EMV, AmEX SafeKey Certifications, and VISA 3RI Delay and Split Shipment | Outseer
original_content: Outseer's July 3-D Secure release focuses on enhancing security and compliance for card issuers through certifications for EMVCo 3DS v2.3.1.1 and AmEx SafeKey 2.2, as well as improved VISA 3RI support for complex payment scenarios. These updates aim to reduce fraud, improve the cardholder experience, and ensure adherence to the latest global protocols and card scheme requirements.

title: 3-D Secure: Navigating Compliance Changes | Outseer
original_content: This blog post discusses the importance of EMVCo's 3-D Secure protocol and Outseer's role in helping businesses navigate the complexities of global, regional, and local compliance requirements for card-not-present payments, including SCA and Sweden's BankID. Outseer's 3-D Secure solution offers adaptable features and expert guidance to ensure businesses can effectively mitigate fraud, meet regulatory obligations, and provide secure, user-friendly transaction experiences.

title: 3-D Secure: Everything You Need to Know | Outseer
original_content: This blog post explains 3-D Secure (3DS) as a security protocol designed to prevent online fraud by authenticating consumers with their card issuers. Initially cumbersome, the latest versions (3DS 2.x) have significantly improved the user experience with risk-based authentication, leading to higher conversion rates and robust security, while also offering merchant-friendly features like liability shifts and automatic enrollment. Outseer offers a 3DS solution that leverages a risk engine enriched by global data, to better reduce fraud and improve the checkout experience.
smart_summary: Initially cumbersome, the latest versions (3DS 2.x) have significantly improved the user experience with risk-based authentication, leading to higher conversion rates and robust security, while also offering merchant-friendly features like liability shifts and automatic enrollment. title: 3-D Secure Authentication: What It Is & Why It’s Needed | Outseer
original_content: The blog post explains 3-D Secure authentication as a crucial payment protocol that adds an extra layer of fraud protection for online transactions by verifying customer identity with their card issuer. It highlights the importance of 3-D Secure in combating card-not-present fraud, particularly with the rise of e-commerce, and emphasizes the use of risk assessment and frictionless flows to balance security with a positive customer experience.

title: 5 Post-Pandemic Payments Trends | Outseer
original_content: The Outseer blog post discusses five post-pandemic payment trends driven by the shift to digital channels and increased customer expectations for fast, secure, and flexible transactions. These trends include the rise of risk-based authentication, the importance of diverse payment options, the growth of embedded finance, and the corresponding increase in transaction fraud that companies must proactively address. Ultimately, innovation and robust fraud prevention are crucial for success in the evolving payments landscape.

title: Account Takeover Protection: Everything You Need to Know | Outseer
original_content: Account Takeover (ATO) occurs when fraudsters steal credentials to access legitimate accounts, enabling them to conduct unauthorized transactions and steal sensitive information. Effective ATO protection employs machine learning and data science to detect anomalous login behavior and requires a combination of business and consumer actions, including implementing multi-factor authentication, educating users, and utilizing advanced fraud prevention solutions. Outseer offers a solution that leverages these techniques to protect accounts while minimizing user friction.
smart_summary: Effective ATO protection employs machine learning and data science to detect anomalous login behavior and requires a combination of business and consumer actions, including implementing multi-factor authentication, educating users, and utilizing advanced fraud prevention solutions. Account Takeover (ATO) occurs when fraudsters steal credentials to access legitimate accounts, enabling them to conduct unauthorized transactions and steal sensitive information.

title: Adaptive Authentication: What Is It & How Does It Work? | Outseer
original_content: Adaptive authentication dynamically adjusts authentication requirements based on the risk associated with a login or transaction, using factors like location, device, and behavior to differentiate legitimate users from malicious actors. This approach protects against fraud and account takeovers by requiring additional authentication only when suspicious activity is detected, improving security without adding unnecessary friction for genuine users. By leveraging machine learning and customizable risk scores, adaptive authentication offers a more effective and user-friendly alternative to standard authentication methods.
smart_summary: This approach protects against fraud and account takeovers by requiring additional authentication only when suspicious activity is detected, improving security without adding unnecessary friction for genuine users. By leveraging machine learning and customizable risk scores, adaptive authentication offers a more effective and user-friendly alternative to standard authentication methods.

title: Aspen Report: A National Strategy to Prevent Scams | Outseer
original_content: The Aspen Institute report highlights the escalating threat of consumer scams and proposes a comprehensive national strategy involving government, industry, and civil society. It emphasizes the need for coordinated action, data sharing, and a national "duty of care" framework to prevent scams and disrupt criminal networks, treating it as a national security issue. Key recommendations include government leadership, private sector engagement, and enhanced scam prevention measures across various sectors.

title: Enhancing Account Takeover Detection With Identity-centric, Biometric Protections | Outseer
original_content: Outseer's blog post highlights new biometric enhancements to their Fraud Manager, aimed at bolstering account takeover (ATO) and enrollment fraud prevention. These updates include effortless ID verification using facial recognition during enrollment and FIDO2 compliant biometrics for stronger account compromise protection, all designed to improve security while minimizing user friction. The enhancements are part of the Outseer Beyond™ program, expanding anti-fraud capabilities through third-party partnerships.

title: Command & Control Servers: The Rise of the Hook | Outseer
original_content: The complete leak of the Hook Android banking trojan's source code in late 2023 has led to a surge in its usage, with over 200 new Command & Control servers detected. This leak empowers more threat actors, even those with limited technical skills, to deploy customized Hook variants for fraudulent activities, blurring the lines between established malware groups and "newcomers." Outseer anticipates further evolution and increased sophistication of Hook-based threats, emphasizing the need for proactive detection and termination of malicious servers.

title: Top Strategies for Risk-Based Transaction Monitoring | Outseer
original_content: Risk-based transaction monitoring uses statistical analysis and machine learning to assign risk scores to transactions, allowing businesses to focus on high-risk activities while minimizing disruption to legitimate customers. Key to effective risk-based monitoring is leveraging diverse data points and global intelligence networks to continuously improve risk models and adapt to new threats. Solutions like Outseer use sophisticated algorithms to provide accurate and transparent risk scoring, enabling businesses to prevent fraud without sacrificing customer experience.

title: Rogue Apps: What They Are & Top Techniques to Prevent Them | Outseer
original_content: Rogue apps impersonate trusted brands to steal user information and commit fraud, costing individuals and businesses significant money. These malicious apps can install malware, steal credentials, or charge fraudulent fees, and their prevalence is increasing. Businesses and individuals can defend against rogue apps by monitoring app stores for brand impersonation, reviewing app permissions, and only installing apps from official marketplaces.

title: CYBERWARFARE: How the Russia-Ukraine Crisis Threatens Cybersecurity Worldwide | Outseer
original_content: The Russia-Ukraine crisis has triggered a new era of cyberwarfare, with attacks like DDoS, phishing, and malware targeting both Ukrainian and Russian entities, and potentially impacting global cybersecurity. Organizations worldwide should prepare for a widening blast radius of cyberthreats, including retaliatory nation-state attacks, as the conflict escalates and economic sanctions against Russia increase the risk of cyberattacks against Western targets.

title: Scan & Scam: QR Codes, Touchless Payments & CNP Fraud | Outseer
original_content: The rise of QR codes for touchless payments presents new opportunities for CNP and ATO fraud, as malicious actors can exploit these codes to redirect users to phishing sites or initiate fraudulent transactions. Businesses need to implement robust verification measures, such as geolocation and behavioral data analysis, to prevent these attacks and protect sensitive customer information. Outseer offers solutions leveraging EMV 3-D Secure and comprehensive data to effectively combat QR code-related fraud and protect businesses' reputations.
